name: Faith (Hebrews 11:1)
description:
Creating this larger complex, colorful, collage on 22 in. x 30 in. paper expended considerable time, personal energies and valuable artistic supplies in ways that I had not previously experienced.

I had always taken great care not to crease or wrinkle the papers I was working with - making every effort to keep the papers as clean and pristine as possible. In this case, for the purpose of scanning the artwork, I deliberately divided the artwork (after a lot of inking and coloring) into sixteen quadrants with three vertical and three horizontal folds. 

This was a risk, since I couldn't be sure, until after performing the actual task, that creating these folds wouldn't be destructive to the final result (wasting the previous efforts made).

For these and other reasons, this artwork is titled 'Faith' and the artwork is now framed and on sale at New Vision Art (based in Orem, Utah).

This photograph of the artwork atop my light table helps to communicate the raw efforts and emotionally visceral process involved in creating the work.

This original artwork is by Daniel H. Bartholomew

https://www.newvisionart.com/collections/daniel-bartholomew/products/faith-hebrews-11-1-original
